question.title: How do I control the placement of shapes in a Group in JavaFX?
question.body:
I want to add buttons to my app, and I want the buttons to show multiple shapes. These shapes could be ellipses, polygons, or other shapes. And I want to repeat them in some of the buttons. So, for example, I might want to show three identical polygons, side by side, in a Button. I've instantiated the polygon with all its points. As far as I can tell, I need to put them in a Group, and add that Group to my Button. But I don't see a way to specify the position of the polygons in the group.

Of course, I could create three identical polygons with different coordinates, but they're all the same shape in different positions. I would really like to place the first one, then translate the next two horizontally before placing them. But I don't see a method to translate a shape, either in the Shape class, the Polygon class, or the Group class.

I also considered using the Canvas class. The Canvas can give me a GraphicsContext, which has a translate() method. But unfortunately, it doesn't have a method that takes my Polygon. Instead, it has a strokePolygon() method that takes a set of points. Unfortunately, Polygon is just one of the shapes I might be drawing. It might also be an Ellipse, or something else. And canvas doesn't have a method to draw whatever Shape I've instantiated, like strokeShape(Shape shape). Without this method, my code starts to get really complicated.

So in a nutshell, The Group and the Canvas each have a different problem. The Group will draw a generic shape of any class, but I don't see a way to translate them to draw multiple copies. The Canvas will let me do the translations, but I need to call different methods for different shapes. They're both clumsy ways to write the code. Of course, there are plenty of ways to draw these shapes, but I need them to show on a Button, so it has to be on something that I can pass to the Button constructor: Button(String text, Node graphic). Is there a cleaner way to do this? Is there something I'm missing?

question_comments.body: Just create all your polygons with the same coordinates, set the translate properties to move them, and add them to a group as you yourself describe in the question. Not sure what you’re missing about this. There is no need for a canvas or graphics context.

@James_D It hadn't occurred to me that translate would be a property I could set, so I skipped over the setXxx() methos. But I still don't know how to draw a Shape. The GraphicsContext class doesn't have a draw, fill, or stroke method that takes a shape, so I don't see the point of the Shape class.

@VGR That's the kind of verbose code I'm trying to avoid. In a reasonable API, I could just reuse a single Ellipse through a simple translation. Code like what you're suggesting is verbose, error prone, and hard to maintain. And it's much simpler to do this with an Ellipse than with a Polygon.

Maybe I’m missing something. Is it really too much work to write Ellipse newEllipse = new Ellipse(existingEllipse.getCenterX() + existingEllipse.getRadiusX(), existingEllipse.getCenterY(), existingEllipse.getRadiusX(), existingEllipse.getRadiusY()); and then do something similar for every type of Shape you support?
Why not use use a container class like HBox?

All Node classes, including Shape, inherit a rich API for performing transforms, including translations. Probably all you need here is setTranslateX'(…) and setTranslateY(…). See the “Transformations” section of the documentation
